title: mealPrep
description: A consolidation of recipes that brings together the ingredients and instructions from multiple recipes to prepare these items in bulk.

name.description: Provide the name of the recipe.

notes.description: Include the names of the recipes being consolidated. Use this format: 'The following recipes have been consolidated: - recipe 1 - recipe 2'. Return the text in markdown.

prepTime.description: Specify the total preparation time in ISO 8601 duration format. Estimate this based on the prep time of the individual recipes.

cookTime.description: Specify the cooking time in ISO 8601 duration format. Estimate this based on the cook time of the individual recipes.

recipeIngredients.description: List all the ingredients required to prepare these recipes. For each ingredient, provide quantity, unit of measure, and type of ingredient. When ingredients are similar, make necessary updates so the unit of measure is the same, consolidate into a common ingredient, and state the total quantity required.

quantity.description: Specify the quantity of the ingredient. Where the ingredients are similar, update and display the total quantity.

unit.description: Specify the unit of measure for the ingredient. Where ingredients are similar, update so that they use the same unit of measure.

ingredient.description: Specify the type of ingredient. Where ingredients are similar, update so that the ingredient name is stated consistently.

recipeInstructions.description: Consolidate the instructions to prepare all the recipes. Re-order them in sequence that makes it as efficient as possible to prepare all the recipes, making sure to account for the preparation steps. For example, if some time in the oven is required, have those steps go first so that other preparation and cooking steps can be completed while the item is in the oven. The preparation steps for the items going into the oven should therefore also go first.Assume that there is only 1 oven to be used. Make sure to include instructions to let the cook know to perform steps while items are cooking in the oven. Create sections and sub-sections using heading #1 and #2 markups as required. In each section, make the instructions detailed, focusing on the quantity, unit and ingredient name, key action, and duration. Summarize the key action followed by the detail. Example: <Step summary> - <Step detail>. Bold the step and return the text in markdown. Where it makes sense, reference the name of the recipe that the instruction is for.
